content.raw:
I have the sim machine running OK.  However, the field computer apparently is failing to load the repo.  It is definitely not running ROS.


```
#!python

ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-134:~$ docker images
REPOSITORY          TAG                 IMAGE ID            CREATED             SIZE
ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-134:~$ docker ps
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND             CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES
```

I just used the example Dockerfile in the top level of my own repo.  The next thing I would normally do is just load the example repo.  However, it looks like you have to bring down the whole constellation to do that.  Bringing it down and backup will cost me another 2 hours out of a total of 10, so I am reluctant to waste 2 of my hours just bringing up the example instead of my own repo.  Since I am currently on the second try for this, I have already used up 4 hours.  Given that each reboot uses a minimum of 2 hours, I don't think that 10 hours is going to be nearly enough time to get it working-- that is only 5 tries total.
content.html:
I have the sim machine running OK. However, the field computer apparently is failing to load the repo. It is definitely not running ROS.

ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-134:~$ docker images
REPOSITORY          TAG                 IMAGE ID            CREATED             SIZE
ubuntu@ip-172-31-24-134:~$ docker ps
CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND             CREATED             STATUS              PORTS               NAMES

I just used the example Dockerfile in the top level of my own repo. The next thing I would normally do is just load the example repo. However, it looks like you have to bring down the whole constellation to do that. Bringing it down and backup will cost me another 2 hours out of a total of 10, so I am reluctant to waste 2 of my hours just bringing up the example instead of my own repo. Since I am currently on the second try for this, I have already used up 4 hours. Given that each reboot uses a minimum of 2 hours, I don't think that 10 hours is going to be nearly enough time to get it working-- that is only 5 tries total.
